pros: Had an overall great learning experience there
cons: None really come to mind, the drive was a little rough.

review_title: Dont work here , solid tumor team
job_title: Clinical Data Manager in Baltimore, MD
pros: Sometimes they let you leave early if its a nice day out. They hire people with disabilities and different racial /ethnic backgrounds. Manager allows you to take off work easily when requested.
cons: They require you to go to work 3 times a week. Management likes to scold and threaten you, sometimes belittling you and constantly asking if your doing your job correctly. Huge turnover rate. You hit a wall in growth after a year of doing the same monotonous duties.

pros: The pay, benefits, vacation, and holidays are good- but only because they are dictated by and administered through the State of Maryland (the overall University system).
cons: The School of Medicine is infamous for allowing a toxic and abusive environment for and towards the general staff. Doctors and practice managers are permitted to think they are "gods" that can do whatever they to to whoever they want with no repercussions. HR is utterly useless when it comes to these issues.

pros:
-amazing, kind, and successful team members
-flexible hours
-work from home
cons:
-can feel overworked at times
-little interaction between team

job_title: Bioinformatics Software Engineer II in Baltimore, MD
pros:
I work in a highly cooperative environment with PhD students, postdocs, and professors.
I get to engage in meaningful research that will contribute to improved health outcomes and address racial and economic disparities in genomics.
The health care benefits and time off are generous.
cons: There is a lack of any overall structure to software engineering. Each engineer works on one specific team comprised primarily of people with biological domain expertise. The fact that engineers don't get to interface or have any software development related trainings means that we can't exchange ideas or tips or help each other progress.

review_title: Great benefits and culture; will invest in your growth and good for those looking for a stable career
job_title: Laboratory Research Specialist in Baltimore, MD
pros:
Better salary relative to other local research universities It's not industry money, but it's good for academia. Also, annual state-mandated COLA! Good luck finding that at private academic instituitions. 

Generally a healthier work and research culture than that Baltimore research university...

Great medical benefits, as well as vacation, obscure state holidays, full tuition remission for self and family at Maryland Universities (some exceptions)

Pension plan offered for state employee hires (not contractors) and vestment starts at 7 years.
cons:
Hiring process is a little slow and drawn out, but hey, it's part of a big state run university system

No employer match for 403b retirement option. This isn't a problem if you're planning to work long enough for the pension to vest, but not as good as other places might offer if you think you're going to move on after a few years.

review_title: state institution with low budget and worse management
pros: statewide hospital network of mostly compassionate and concerned health care professionals
cons:
statewide hospital network of mostly compassionate and concerned health care professionals, but who have been ruined by the system they work for

all the components are in place to make this a successful health care network except for the health care part

pros: Good health insurance. Collaborative environment.
cons: None. As a postdoc, things can vary depending on what department you're in, and who your boss is..

pros: great benefit package for employees
cons: lower starting salary for employees

review_title: Good location but it seems like postdocs are a little overlooked
pros:
The city is nice and they are gradually improving the facilities to allow better research
Several places to get away for lunch during the day
Very convenient if you live in the city due to campus shuttles/city buses/free circulator/light rail/subway/right next to I-95 offramp
Regular workshops/seminars for academic career development such as funding, etc.
UMB is next to the hospital so it takes almost no time to visit a PCP/dentis
Farmers market is weekly and 1 block away
less than 6 blocks from baseball and football stadiums if you like local teams
cons:
Urban campus leads to safety issues - robberies/assaults occur
Some facilities need updating desperately
Very little postdoctoral engagement and little resources for postdocs
Not nearly enough seminars, rarely any refreshments during them, and not publicized well enough
I don't think there is enough oversight of postdoc salaries to ensure that raises are occurring according to NIH scale
Career development isn't offering enough resources to finding jobs, especially non-academic jobs

review_title: Excellent Stepping Stone for Bioinformatics Experts
pros: Great culture for young people on our way to a genomics career. Many knowledgeable and talented people. Free courses offered to employees to enhance our skills. There are excellent seminars on site. Founder of the institute is a top leader in genomics research. The institute is very well funded.
cons: 1. The location is unsavory and hazardous. 2. There are too many parties, farewell parties, wedding showers, baby showers, birthdays, it is too much. Plus being asked to contribute $ to each party for people you don't even know is unreasonable, IMHO.

pros: Its very good learning experience. Some of the people are very nice and they offer education if you want to go back and further your information
cons: The nursing staff thats been there for a while are disrespectful and talk at you like they birth you.The shock trama unit is very snotty and nothing is confidential and the pay don't match the little pay

review_title: A Great Graduate Program in Life Sciences
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Baltimore, MD
pros:
The courses are great and there are always more being developed. 
There is a lot of help given in finding a lab to perform your thesis work. 
There are good core facilities that allow you to perform experiments that you lab cannot do in house. 
We have access to an amazing gym. 
The location is very close to the inner harbor, and the baseball stadium.
cons: Until recently there was very little career development help, but this is changing.

review_title: Great place to work, depending on what management you work for.
pros:
Higher salaries than Hopkins
Doctors are helpful and friendly (unlike at Hopkins)
Friendly people to work with
cons: It depends on who is the PI of the research that you work on. Certain PIs are terrible people and should be forced into retirement. depending on the research you work on it isn't easy to advance your career.

review_title: Appropriate opportunity for students who are just beginning to explore careers in research.
pros:
Fair amount of learning opportunities
Flexible hours
Health and tuition benefits available (in some cases)
Retirement plan options available (in some cases)
cons:
Low/stagnant wages
Not many opportunities for advancement

pros: The pay is decent and it's close to home.  Not much else I can say that's positive.  It's a shame.
cons: Upper management acts like a bunch of Nazis.  They take the job way too seriously.  A simple job turns into a complicated mess.  No opportunity for professional growth.  As a contractor, the benefits SUCK !!

pros: You get to see and work with a lot. Great experience. Big hospital so a lot of traumas come in.
cons: The yearly raises are very weak. Only get maybe 1% raise a year. Could get paid more. Every other weekend is a con.

pros: Great health benefits and a dependable work/life balance schedule. In my department promotions were attainable, as your position grows so does your title and salary.
cons: The location is less than ideal, thats putting it nicely. I signed up for the campus alerts to stay on top of snow days and early closures. At least once a week there is an alert about a shooting, robbery, stab...its ridiculous.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Baltimore, MD
pros: There is good support from the administration for postdocs here, and that's not always easy to find. Good benefits (including family leave) and a postdoctoral affairs office that provide lots of opportunities to gain new skills and get help with job searches.
cons: Can be a difficult place to meet people, which can lead to issues of social isolation as well as difficulty networking.

pros:
Good benefits
Multiple job opportunities
Opportunity for personal growth
Opportunity to stay fresh as the research is constantly changing
cons:
No raises
Almost no opportunity for advancement without job hopping
Limited funding  necessitates that coordinaotrs do the work of multiple people

pros: Amazing staff all around. So many opportunities to learn and grow as a medical professional. They take care of you.They offer a variety of plans. And they are very flexible!
cons: The hardest part of the job is juggling 100+ tickets in an eight hour shift while maintaining good customer service and management constantly giving more work without proper help on the floor.

pros: Gives me a great opportunity to work at home and still spend quality time with my kids and make money.
cons: I'm spending less time socializing with the general people and staying connected.

pros: You can really set your own schedule, something great that not many places offer. Awesome environment surrounded by smart people who love doing what they do!
cons: Sometimes it takes a while to get things done with administration, but they are always done.

pros: Research intensive institution with strong support for research
cons: As a researcher funded mostly by resarech grants, there are too much beauracracy for most purchasing and post-award processing.

pros: Well funded research institution with nice facilities and a well regarded faculty. I learned a lot.
cons: Like any other research institution or laboratory, funding is always an issue. Some labs, or even projects within labs were much better funded.

pros: Very well organised institute in the middle of downtown under the University of MD. Good place to start your career in research and working under renowned scientists.
cons: Need to consider safety issues sometimes outside work if one stays near to the place.

review_title: Learn as much as you can while you’re there
pros: Opportunities to learn a lot. Benefits can be pretty good. Make sure you take advantage of tuition remission ASAP if you’re interested.
cons: No room for advancement. Little money to be made in academia.

pros: Generally coworkers are pleasant and willing to help out
cons: The amount of bureaucracy makes it hard to get things done within a reasonable time frame, questionable level of cultural competency

pros: If you're considering going back to school for an advanced degree, it's a good place to network at work.
cons: The pay isn't that great.

review_title: Good institution to work for in Maryland
pros:
Great benefits for employees
Carpool system
cons:
No definite status for postdoctoral fellows, no retirement benefits for postdocs either
No daycare

job_title: Surgical Services Research Program Manager in York, PA
pros: Great benefits, good people to work with,  learned a lot about research and human research protections
cons: Little upward mobility, pay, got to know someone to move up

review_title: A great institute for biomedical research
pros: It is a fantastic place for receiving your education, especially in the  biomedical science
cons: So far nothing came to my mind

review_title: Great place to work but not flexiable
pros: Steady Job, steady paycheck, coworkers are great
cons: Not flexible Hours.  write ups for simple things.

pros: downtown Baltimore, slow pace working environment, lots of time to learn in Research
cons: pay is not great, tons of student interns

job_title: Laboratory Research Technician in Baltimore, MD
pros: Good work environment, many interesting projects, secure funding, respect for personal life
cons: None that are specific to the University

pros: Good benefits, pay, and PTO
cons: Some Managers are not qualified

pros: Good pay benefits clean etc
cons: Heavy workload no appreciation for all the extras u do

pros: Travel time was short, didn't have to travel far.
cons: Management not available to talk to.

pros: career advancement, expert staff and faculty, friendly environment
cons: job depends on funding, no security, far from my home

job_title: Epidemiological Research Assistant in Catonsville, MD
pros: Great work situation, very accommodating, lots to learn
cons: I live farther away than I'd like.

pros: personal growth, office culture and time-off policies
cons: promotions and company values, work life balance

job_title: Medical Billing Specialist in Baltimore, MD
pros: Everything great awesome nice wonderful
cons: Nothing To complain about at all

pros: Higher than normal RA salary
cons: lots of work when you are an RA

pros: Good place to work. Good team work.
cons: Nothing is bad about this place.

pros: excellent management, great leadership, continuous training
